title.value: Mirror Descent Algorithms with Nearly Dimension-Independent Rates for Differentially-Private Stochastic Saddle-Point Problems
title.justification: The paper discusses algorithms based on Stochastic Mirror Descent for differentially-private stochastic saddle-point problems.
title.quote: Mirror Descent Algorithms with Nearly Dimension-Independent Rates for Differentially-Private Stochastic Saddle-Point Problems

extractions.description: The paper proposes differentially-private algorithms based on stochastic mirror descent that achieve nearly dimension-independent convergence rates for convex-concave stochastic saddle-point problems. These algorithms demonstrate improved rates under first and second-order smoothness assumptions and also provide new insights into privacy optimization.

type.justification: The paper proposes and analyzes algorithms and their performance in differentially-private settings, focusing on empirical results and convergence rates.
type.quote: We propose two algorithms for DP-SSP, based on (entropic) Stochastic Mirror Descent (SMD)...

name.justification: The paper focuses on differentially-private machine learning algorithms for optimizing stochastic saddle-point problems.
name.quote: Protecting privacy of users’ data has become a key desideratum in machine learning.

name.justification: The algorithms are aimed at achieving differentially-private optimization, a key domain in privacy-preserving machine learning.
name.quote: In this context, differential privacy (DP) has become the de facto standard for private data analysis...

name.justification: The focus on developing algorithms for solving saddle-point problems falls under the optimization domain.
name.quote: Recently, a line of research has studied DP stochastic saddle-points... These works focus... on stochastic entropic mirror-descent...

name.justification: The paper contributes differentially-private algorithms based on Stochastic Mirror Descent for stochastic saddle-point problems.
name.quote: We propose two algorithms for DP-SSP, based on (entropic) Stochastic Mirror Descent (SMD)...

is_contributed.justification: The paper proposes new contributions to the SMD, specifically tailored for differential privacy in the context of saddle-point problems.
is_contributed.quote: We propose two algorithms for DP-SSP, based on (entropic) Stochastic Mirror Descent (SMD)...

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses experimental results and theoretical proofs for the proposed algorithms.
is_executed.quote: ...our mirror-descent based algorithms achieve nearly-dimension independent convegence rates for DP-SCO in the polyhedral setting.

is_compared.justification: The paper discusses the advantages and improvements of their SMD algorithms but does not provide direct comparisons with other models.
is_compared.quote: ...our work is the first that does not use a Frank-Wolfe based method to get this type of guarantee.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper contributes a variant of Stochastic Mirror Descent without explicitly referencing a prior specific implementation

name.justification: The paper discusses challenges in differentially-private synthetic data generation, and proposes an algorithm for this setting.
name.quote: Consider a finite sample space Z...Our goal is to construct a synthetic dataset S̃ such that S̃ is private...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset role aligns with synthetic data generation and differential privacy challenges discussed.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The private lower bound follows from [Bun et al., 2014] combined with a resampling argument...
